snippet: The French restaurant, owned by Georges and Marie-Thérèse Briguet for more than 50 years, has become a Midtown East neighborhood haunt though bills average nearly $100 per person.
abstract: Neighborhood Joint column on Le Perigord, French restaurant on East 52nd Street in Manhattan that has maintained same elegant aesthetic for 50 years and has devoted group of regulars.
lead_paragraph: The French restaurant, owned by Georges and Marie-Thérèse Briguet for more than 50 years, has become a Midtown East neighborhood haunt though bills average nearly $100 per person.

headline.print_headline: To Start, a Kiss on Both Cheeks
headline.main: At Le Périgord, Few Changes Since Burton and Taylor Dined There in ’64
